AD_PROCESS_PARA.NAME: Document No
AD_PROCESS_PARA.DESCRIPTION: Document sequence number of the document
AD_PROCESS_PARA.HELP:
The document number is usually automatically generated by the system and determined by the document type of the document. If the document is not saved, the preliminary number is displayed in "<>".
If the document type of your document has no automatic document sequence defined, the field is empty if you create a new document. This is for documents which usually have an external number (like vendor invoice). If you leave the field empty, the system will generate a document number for you. The document sequence used for this fallback number is defined in the "Maintain Sequence" window with the name "DocumentNo_<TableName>", where TableName is the actual name of the table (e.g. C_Order).

So, @Name@ would resolve into the User name (if user is defined defined), then Business Partner name (if business partner is defined) and then the Name of the business object if it has a Name.

AD_PROCESS_PARA.HELP: The Business Partner Group provides a method of defining defaults to be used for individual Business Partners.

AD_PROCESS_PARA.NAME: Document Type
AD_PROCESS_PARA.HELP: The Document Type determines document sequence and processing rules

AD_PROCESS_PARA.NAME: Document Status
AD_PROCESS_PARA.DESCRIPTION: The current status of the document
AD_PROCESS_PARA.HELP: The Document Status indicates the status of a document at this time. If you want to change the document status, use the Document Action field

AD_PROCESS_PARA.NAME: Client
AD_PROCESS_PARA.HELP: A Client is a company or a legal entity. You cannot share data between Clients. Tenant is a synonym for Client.

AD_PROCESS_PARA.NAME: Business Partner
AD_PROCESS_PARA.HELP: A Business Partner is anyone with whom you transact. This can include Vendor, Customer, Employee or Salesperson

AD_PROCESS_PARA.NAME: Accounting Schema
AD_PROCESS_PARA.HELP: An Accounting Schema defines the rules used in accounting such as costing method, currency and calendar

AD_PROCESS_PARA.NAME: Mail Template
AD_PROCESS_PARA.HELP:
The Mail Template indicates the mail template for return messages. Mail text can include variables. The priority of parsing is User/Contact, Business Partner and then the underlying business object (like Request, Dunning, Workflow object).
So, @Name@ would resolve into the User name (if user is defined defined), then Business Partner name (if business partner is defined) and then the Name of the business object if it has a Name.
For Multi-Lingual systems, the template is translated based on the Business Partner's language selection.

AD_PROCESS_PARA.NAME: Organization
AD_PROCESS_PARA.HELP: An organization is a unit of your client or legal entity - examples are store, department. You can share data between organizations.

AD_PROCESS_PARA.NAME: Product Category
AD_PROCESS_PARA.HELP: Identifies the category which this product belongs to. Product categories are used for pricing and selection.

AD_PROCESS_PARA.NAME: Warehouse
AD_PROCESS_PARA.HELP: The Warehouse identifies a unique Warehouse where products are stored or Services are provided.

AD_PROCESS_PARA.NAME: Movement Type
AD_PROCESS_PARA.HELP: The Movement Type indicates the type of movement (in, out, to production, etc)

AD_PROCESS_PARA.NAME: Business Partner
AD_PROCESS_PARA.HELP: A Business Partner is anyone with whom you transact. This can include Vendor, Customer, Employee or Salesperson

AD_PROCESS_PARA.NAME: Date Invoiced
AD_PROCESS_PARA.HELP: The Date Invoice indicates the date printed on the invoice.

AD_PROCESS_PARA.NAME: Date Ordered
AD_PROCESS_PARA.HELP: Indicates the Date an item was ordered.

AD_PROCESS_PARA.NAME: Name
AD_PROCESS_PARA.HELP: The name of an entity (record) is used as an default search option in addition to the search key. The name is up to 60 characters in length.

AD_PROCESS_PARA.NAME: Business Partner
AD_PROCESS_PARA.HELP: A Business Partner is anyone with whom you transact. This can include Vendor, Customer, Employee or Salesperson

AD_PROCESS_PARA.NAME: Only If BP has Balance
AD_PROCESS_PARA.DESCRIPTION: Include only if Business Partner has outstanding Balance

AD_PROCESS_PARA.NAME: Encrypted
AD_PROCESS_PARA.HELP:
Display encryption (in Window/Tab/Field) - all characters are displayed as '*' - in the database it is stored in clear text. You will not be able to report on these columns.
Data storage encryption (in Table/Column) - data is stored encrypted in the database (dangerous!) and you will not be able to report on those columns. Independent from Display encryption.

AD_PROCESS_PARA.NAME: Change the current Setting
AD_PROCESS_PARA.DESCRIPTION: Confirm that you want to change the current setting

AD_PROCESS_PARA.NAME: Cost Type
AD_PROCESS_PARA.DESCRIPTION: Type of Cost (e.g. Current, Plan, Future)
AD_PROCESS_PARA.HELP: You can define multiple cost types. A cost type selected in an Accounting Schema is used for accounting.

AD_PROCESS_PARA.NAME: Organization Type
AD_PROCESS_PARA.DESCRIPTION: Organization Type allows you to categorize your organizations
AD_PROCESS_PARA.HELP: Organization Type allows you to categorize your organizations for reporting purposes

AD_PROCESS_PARA.NAME: Accounting Schema
AD_PROCESS_PARA.HELP: An Accounting Schema defines the rules used in accounting such as costing method, currency and calendar

AD_PROCESS_PARA.NAME: To Product
AD_PROCESS_PARA.DESCRIPTION: Product to be converted to (must have UOM Conversion defined to From Product)

AD_PROCESS_PARA.NAME: Locator
AD_PROCESS_PARA.HELP: The Locator indicates where in a Warehouse a product is located.

AD_PROCESS_PARA.NAME: Account Date
AD_PROCESS_PARA.HELP: The Accounting Date indicates the date to be used on the General Ledger account entries generated from this document. It is also used for any currency conversion.

AD_PROCESS_PARA.NAME: Details/Source First
AD_PROCESS_PARA.DESCRIPTION: Details and Sources are printed before the Line

AD_PROCESS_PARA.NAME: Sales Representative
AD_PROCESS_PARA.HELP: The Sales Representative indicates the Sales Rep for this Region. Any Sales Rep must be a valid internal user.

AD_PROCESS_PARA.NAME: Request Type
AD_PROCESS_PARA.HELP: Request Types are used for processing and categorizing requests. Options are Account Inquiry, Warranty Issue, etc.

AD_PROCESS_PARA.NAME: User Importance
AD_PROCESS_PARA.DESCRIPTION: Priority of the issue for the User

AD_PROCESS_PARA.NAME: Shipment Date
AD_PROCESS_PARA.HELP: The Shipment Date indicates the date printed on the shipment.
